intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium neofortunatense, commonly known as the Neofortunatense Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny conditions. It produces yellow to orange flowers with ray florets, and its leaves are usually basal, rough, and hairy. Hieracium neofortunatense is often considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
